name: ctalk

screenshots.caption: The Ctalk graphics and I/O libraries support graphical applications for terminals and desktops on machines that have the X Window System.
The digitalclock app can display 12- or 24-hour time and use a variety of window styles on many X desktops.
The FreeTypeTools package contains several simple utilities for FreeType fonts.  The package is downloadable from the Apps folder under the Files section
Ctalk supports TrueType and Type 1 fonts on X displays.  The font in the xfthello.c window is Nimbus Sans L, a Type 1 font in the GNU Ghostscript package.

short_description:
Ctalk is a compact object oriented language that works closely with C.  That means you can use Ctalk for GUI, network, client-server, and systems programs as well as traditional object oriented simulations.  Ctalk includes a just-in-time compiler, extendable class libraries, and a compact run-time library.  Written for use with GNU GCC, Ctalk supports a variety of UNIX and Linux systems, the X Window System, and libraries like the GNU readline library.  

If you want to learn more about Ctalk, you can download the tutorial as a  PDF file on the Downloads page. Ctalk's C preprocessor, Ctpp, is also available as a separate package.
